title: pca_in_one
text: data feature value matrix data frame format, rows represent samples columns represent feature values. contain numeric feature values. Additionally, row names need provided facilitate merging sample data frame plotting purposes.

title: pca_in_one
text: sample sample information matrix, first column contains sample names. default column name sample, specific requirements names columns.
code: #   sample species # 1      1  setosa # 2      2  setosa # 3      3  setosa # 4      4  setosa # 5      5  setosa # 6      6  setosa

title: pca_in_one
text: output list containing: result.pca: output FactoMineR::PCA, can called directly. plot.pca: plotting results, defaulting PC1 PC2. output ggplot object, can fine-tuned using ggplot2. point.data: data used plotting, users can call plots export use software. eigenvalue.pca: explained variance principal components, starting PC1 default.
code: # devtools::install_github("lixiang117423/biohelpers")  library(tidyverse) library(biohelpers)  data <- iris[, 1:4]  sample <- iris$Species %>%   as.data.frame() %>%   rownames_to_column(var = "sample") %>%   set_names(c("sample", "species"))  pca_in_one(data, sample) -> result.pca

what: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
text: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results.

title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
code: cor_and_plot(   data.1,   data.2 = NULL,   method = "pearson",   cor = 0.05,   pvalue = 0.05 )

title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
text: data.1 First Data Frame. column represents feature value. data.2 Second Data Frame. column represents feature value. method three options calculating correlation: `pearson`, `kendall`,`spearman`, `pearson` default. cor Correlation threshold, default 0.5. pvalue P-value threshold, default 0.05.

title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
text: data frame containing calculation results.

title: Calculate Correlation, Return Correlation Results. — cor_and_plot
code: library(biohelpers)  x <- iris[, 1:4] y <- iris[, 1:4]  cor_and_plot(data.1 = x, data.2 = y) -> result.cor #> Joining with `by = join_by(from, to)`

title: Identification of Outliers. — find_outliner
text: Identification Outliers.

title: Identification of Outliers. — find_outliner
text: x Numeric Format Vector.

title: Identification of Outliers. — find_outliner
text: Vector. outlier, return 'yes'; otherwise, return ''.

title: Identification of Outliers. — find_outliner
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(biohelpers)  data(iris)  iris %>%   dplyr::group_by(Species) %>%   dplyr::mutate(is.out = find_outliner(Sepal.Length)) %>%   dplyr::ungroup() -> result.find_outlinr

text: "Perform simple linear regression calculations return corresponding plot."

data input data frame contains information @param x, @param y, @param group, @param color. x Independent variable, also used X-axis plot. y Dependent variable, also used Y-axis plot. group column name used differentiate groups, also serves grouping information batch calculations regression coefficients P-values. color color scatter plot graph.
list containing data frame plot, data frame includes regression coefficients P-values, plot scatter plot.

code: library(biohelpers)  df <- iris lm_and_plot(   data = df,   x = "Sepal.Length",   y = "Sepal.Width",   group = "Species",   color = "Species" ) -> results.lm

what: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — pca_in_one
title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — pca_in_one
text: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) return results.

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — pca_in_one
code: pca_in_one(   data,   sample,   pca.num = 5,   plot = TRUE,   x = "pc1",   y = "pc2",   color = "species",   shape = "species" )

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — pca_in_one
text: data data frame rows samples columns indicators. sample data frame containing sample information, one column sample names match @param data description, without need row names. pca.num returned results include number principal components, default value 10. plot Whether plot, default draw scatter plot. plotted graph ggplot2 object, can customized enhanced using ggplot2. x principal component use X-axis, default pc1. y principal component use Y-axis, default pc2. color grouping information use color points, default species. shape grouping information use shape points, default species.

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — pca_in_one
text: list containing calculation results, scree plot, scatter plot, COS2 plot.

title: Perform principal component analysis (PCA) and return the results. — pca_in_one
code: library(dplyr) library(tibble) library(magrittr)  data <- iris[, 1:4] sample <- iris$Species %>%   as.data.frame() %>%   rownames_to_column(var = "sample") %>%   set_names(c("sample", "species"))  pca_in_one(data, sample) -> result.pca

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
text: ggplot2 plotting theme.

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
code: plot_theme(   base.size = 10,   strip.text.italic = FALSE,   show.minor.tricks.x = FALSE,   show.minor.tricks.y = TRUE )

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
text: base.size Default font size. strip.text.italic Whether font italic displayed groups. show.minor.tricks.x Whether display minor ticks X-axis. show.minor.tricks.y Whether display minor ticks y-axis.

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
text: ggplot2 plot theme.

title: ggplot2 plotting theme. — plot_theme
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(biohelpers)  data(iris)  iris %>%   ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point() +   plot_theme()

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
text: Title

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
text: data Input data data frame format, specifically long data format, tidyr format. col Typically, column name sample names located. row Typically, column name feature names located. value column name numerical values needed plotting heatmap located.

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
text: data frame.

title: Title — reorder2heatmap
code: library(dplyr) library(biohelpers)  data(df.reorder2heatmap)  reorder2heatmap(   data = df.reorder2heatmap,   col = "sample",   row = "meta",   value = "value" ) -> df.reorder
